meanings.definition: In a vague or unclear manner
meanings.sent1: She looked hazily at the distant mountains, unable to make out their shapes clearly.
meanings.sent2: The memory of the dream faded hazily as she woke up.
meanings.sent3: He hazily followed the instructions, resulting in a cake that looked more like a pancake.
meanings.sent4: The mist hazily enveloped the entire forest, creating an ethereal atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The streetlights hazily illuminated the path, casting long shadows in the fog.

meanings.definition: With a lack of clarity or sharpness
meanings.sent1: The hazily written note was difficult to decipher.
meanings.sent2: The hazily defined boundaries led to confusion among the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The hazily focused camera produced blurry images of the event.
meanings.sent4: His hazily remembered childhood seemed like scenes from a distant dream.
meanings.sent5: The hazily painted landscape gave the impression of a fading memory.
